name: df-aj
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(caj, cmpo(s0, s1, cnv, cnv, copab(s2, s3, w3a(wf(cv(s2), cfv(cba, cv(s0)), cfv(cba, cv(s1))), wf(cv(s3), cfv(cba, cv(s1)), cfv(cba, cv(s0))), wral(s4, cfv(cba, cv(s0)), wral(s5, cfv(cba, cv(s1)), wceq(co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cfv(cdip, cv(s1)), cv(s5)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cdip, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s3), cv(s5))))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ adj =(s0 ∈ NrmCVec, s1 ∈ NrmCVec ↦ { < s2, s3 > |((s2 :(BaseSet ` s0)→(BaseSet ` s1))∧(s3 :(BaseSet ` s1)→(BaseSet ` s0))∧ ∀(s4 ∈(BaseSet ` s0), ∀(s5 ∈(BaseSet ` s1),((s2 ` s4)[(.iOLD ` s1)]s5)=(s4[(.iOLD ` s0)](s3 ` s5)))))})
comment: Define the adjoint of an operator (if it exists). The domain of ` U adj W ` is the set of all operators from ` U ` to ` W ` that have an adjoint. Definition 3.9-1 of [Kreyszig] p. 196, although we don't require that ` U ` and ` W ` be Hilbert spaces nor that the operators be linear. Although we define it for any normed vector space for convenience, the definition is meaningful only for inner product spaces. (Contributed by NM, 25-Jan-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
